Name.Raw: Master of Science in Development Studies

EducationDetails.Text:
School of Oriental and African Studies, University of London	Sept 2019
Master of Science in Development Studies, merit--fourth in 2019 global QS World rankings--focused on the practice of
international development with coursework in foreign aid, digital campaigning, gender equity, social justice, and political
economy. Undertaken alongside a part-time consultancy role at Justice Defenders.

SchoolName.Raw: School of Oriental and African Studies, University of London

EducationDetails.Text:
Asian Institute of Management, Philippines	May 2015
Business Management programme with coursework in accounting, finance, and economics

Ateneo de Manila University, Philippines	Mar 2015
Bachelor of Arts in Communication, cum laude (top 5% of class)--coursework in development communication, digital
marketing, public relations, and features/news writing. Vice President of 1,000-member organisation working to end child sexual
abuse in the Philippines. Marketing and Communications Intern at the Philippine Red Cross.

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~~   is experienced in the management of:  Marketing; and Sales.    ~~~~~~~~   has 5 years of work experience, with 3 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Current position is a mid-level management role: Partnerships Manager
Starting on 3/1/2019, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 2 years and 4 months:
	Title: Partnerships Manager for Justice Defenders
Starting on 7/1/2015, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 9 months:
	Title: Account Executive

Positions.Description:
a nonprofit that bridges the justice gap for vulnerable communities in Africa through
legal education and practice.
Partnerships Manager, London	March 2019-Present
Led execution of the organisation-wide fundraising strategy across income streams (i.e. individual, institutional, and corporate);
developed cultivation and stewardship strategies for all prospects and funders that led to a revenue increase of 80% - from £1M to £1.8M in 2019. This allowed the expansion of the fundraising and comms team, resulting in further donations and achieving
impact targets (e.g. enabling 15,000 fair trials in East Africa)
Led the organisation's Covid-19 fundraising campaign in 2020, securing £230,000 worth of grants from new institutional funders, which kept programmes running and expanding amidst the pandemic
In charge of digital outreach, grant writing, report writing, and fundraising tactics; secured $250,000 from Google among others
Spearheaded major donor visit to East Africa in 2019 resulting in a $1.5M donation and oversaw the planning and execution of communication and fundraising events
Led the organisation's online giving campaign (e.g. Big Give UK - raised £25K beyond £20K target in 2019)
Worked on the organisation's rebrand as Justice Defenders, which better positioned the organisation for growth and resulted in increased media engagements and donations
Supported the social media response to the organisation's recent feature on 60 Minutes with Anderson Cooper, engaging 1,000
new donors in the first hour

a global social enterprise based in San Francisco and Manila that provides strategic
organisational development services to leading nonprofits spanning 30 countries.
Senior Development Associate, Manila	Aug 2016-Sep 2018
Served as nonprofit clients' strategic partner for organisational development, fundraising, marketing, and communications --
Justice Defenders, my current company, was one of the my clients
Thought partner for nonprofit leaders operating in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Asia, and the US across various issue areas
e.g. STEM education for girls, agriculture, criminal justice, global/maternal health, renewable energy, climate change
Led a team to create and implement fundraising and communication strategies, translating client needs into smart workflows,
managing solutions from planning to execution and evaluation, reaching annual funding targets worth up to $4M
Designed and executed social media campaigns for global health and justice clients, resulting in increased online donors and audience reach
Expanded funder pipelines, diversified income streams, developed strategic content (e.g. social media posts, theory of change
models, business plans, newsletters, donor reports, concept notes, and proposals to large family foundations, corporations, and major individual donors)
Competencies include strategy development, grant writing and reporting, team management, digital fundraising, research,
prospecting, and marketing

EON, Stakeholder Relations Group -- a public affairs and government relations consultancy designed to move campaigns and advocacies forward.

Developed and implemented corporate social responsibility strategies for fortune 500 companies operating in highly-regulated
industries in the Philippines (e.g. agriculture, public health, energy, and transportation)
Competencies include campaign planning and roll-out, project management, brand development, and event management

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
~~~~~~~~  
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   |    ~~~~~~~~~~  
I have a strong track record of working with nonprofit partners to deliver high impact programmes supporting disadvantaged
communities across the globe. My experience in fundraising, communications, and account management, specifically for social
sector organisations, enables me to provide strategic partnership and deliver high-quality assets in the nonprofit space.


WORK EXPERIENCE
Justice Defenders -- a nonprofit that bridges the justice gap for vulnerable communities in Africa through
legal education and practice.
Partnerships Manager, London	March 2019-Present
Led execution of the organisation-wide fundraising strategy across income streams (i.e. individual, institutional, and corporate);
developed cultivation and stewardship strategies for all prospects and funders that led to a revenue increase of 80% - from £1M
to £1.8M in 2019. This allowed the expansion of the fundraising and comms team, resulting in further donations and achieving
impact targets (e.g. enabling 15,000 fair trials in East Africa)
Led the organisation's Covid-19 fundraising campaign in 2020, securing £230,000 worth of grants from new institutional funders,
which kept programmes running and expanding amidst the pandemic
In charge of digital outreach, grant writing, report writing, and fundraising tactics; secured $250,000 from Google among others
Spearheaded major donor visit to East Africa in 2019 resulting in a $1.5M donation and oversaw the planning and execution of
communication and fundraising events
Led the organisation's online giving campaign (e.g. Big Give UK - raised £25K beyond £20K target in 2019)
Worked on the organisation's rebrand as Justice Defenders, which better positioned the organisation for growth and resulted in
increased media engagements and donations
Supported the social media response to the organisation's recent feature on 60 Minutes with Anderson Cooper, engaging 1,000
new donors in the first hour

Smarter Good Inc. -- a global social enterprise based in San Francisco and Manila that provides strategic
organisational development services to leading nonprofits spanning 30 countries.
Senior Development Associate, Manila	Aug 2016-Sep 2018
Served as nonprofit clients' strategic partner for organisational development, fundraising, marketing, and communications --
Justice Defenders, my current company, was one of the my clients
Thought partner for nonprofit leaders operating in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Asia, and the US across various issue areas
e.g. STEM education for girls, agriculture, criminal justice, global/maternal health, renewable energy, climate change
Led a team to create and implement fundraising and communication strategies, translating client needs into smart workflows,
managing solutions from planning to execution and evaluation, reaching annual funding targets worth up to $4M
Designed and executed social media campaigns for global health and justice clients, resulting in increased online donors and
audience reach
Expanded funder pipelines, diversified income streams, developed strategic content (e.g. social media posts, theory of change
models, business plans, newsletters, donor reports, concept notes, and proposals to large family foundations, corporations, and
major individual donors)
Competencies include strategy development, grant writing and reporting, team management, digital fundraising, research,
prospecting, and marketing

EON, Stakeholder Relations Group -- a public affairs and government relations consultancy designed to
move campaigns and advocacies forward.
Account Executive, Manila	Jul 2015 - Apr 2016
Developed and implemented corporate social responsibility strategies for fortune 500 companies operating in highly-regulated
industries in the Philippines (e.g. agriculture, public health, energy, and transportation)
Competencies include campaign planning and roll-out, project management, brand development, and event management


EDUCATION
